ABANDONED.Definition: left behind or stopped being used

SHINY.Definition: bright and reflective, like a polished surface

NUANCES.Definition: small details or differences that are not obvious

BEND.Definition: make it curve or change shape

MELT.Definition: change from solid to liquid using heat

DECORATIVE.Definition: used to make something look nice, not for practical use

RESISTANT.Definition: able to withstand or hold out against damage

CORRODE.Definition: get slowly damaged or eaten away

RUST.Definition: turn red as a result of reacting with air and water

RARITY.Definition: the fact of being uncommon or hard to find

DURABILITY.Definition: lasting a long time without breaking or getting damaged

MALLEABILITY.Definition: ability to be easily shaped or bent

TENDED.Definition: often happened in this way or were likely

FRUSTRATING.Definition: annoying or causing irritation because of difficulty

PRECEDENT.Definition: an event that was used as an example

ENABLED.Definition: made possible or allowed to happen

CIRCULATION.Definition: the movement or flow around the system

FLOODED.Definition: filled or overwhelmed with too much of it

STABILISING.Definition: making things steady or less likely to change

STABLE.Definition: steady and unlikely to change or fall

INFLATION.Definition: a rise in prices, making money worth less

INTERVENE.Definition: step in to change or stop something

RIGID.Definition: strict, not flexible or able to change easily

TIED THEIR HANDS.Definition: stopped them from being able to act

ABANDON.Definition: give up or stop using it

CAME TO A HEAD.Definition: reached a critical or important point

BALANCE THEIR BUDGETS.Definition: make sure that spending does not exceed income

IN SOME SHAPE OR FORM.Definition: in some way, of any type

SCANDAL.Definition: a shocking event that caused public anger
